sense.def: BUDDH: dharma-master (this usually refers to Buddhist masters specialized on the exegesis of Buddhist scriptures; in Zen texts dharma-masters frequently serve as punching bags, representing Buddhists of 'inferior' knowledge based on scriptual studies, often contrasted to the Zen master's wisdom based on 'direct insight'); SANSKRIT dharma-bhāṇaka

BUDDH: dharma-master (this usually refers to Buddhist masters specialized on the exegesis of Buddhist scriptures; in Zen texts dharma-masters frequently serve as punching bags, representing Buddhists of 'inferior' knowledge based on scriptual studies, often contrasted to the Zen master's wisdom based on 'direct insight')
